Question_2_to_5

Class Snap

  • java.lang.Object
    • Question_2_to_5.Snap

  • public class Snap
extends java.lang.Object
    Snap game where players take turn putting cards in the pile, anyone who runs out of cards, loses. Players can call snap if the two card's values are the same to keep their card count up higher than the opponent.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int PLAYER_1 
      int PLAYER_2 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Snap()
      Makes player 1 start the turn, and setups the initialized empty decks.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Card drawCard(int player)
      Draws a card, putting it in the pile, change the turn, and returning the drawn card.
      int getPlayerCardsRemaining(int player)
      Returns the overall amount of cards in the specified player's deck.
      int getPlayerTurn()
      Returns the player turn when called.
      boolean hasGameFinished()
      Checks whether anyone has won yet, through running out of cards.
      boolean isWinner(int player)
      Checks whether a player has won or not.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      boolean snap(int player)
      The player that calls the snap has 2 possibilities: 1) - If the two card's values are the same, the player who calls gets the pile.
      2) - If the two card's values are not the same, the other player gets the pile.

    • Method Detail

      • snap

        public boolean snap(int player)
        The player that calls the snap has 2 possibilities: 1) - If the two card's values are the same, the player who calls gets the pile.
        2) - If the two card's values are not the same, the other player gets the pile.
        Parameters:
        player - Which player called the snap (1 or 2).
        Returns:
        whether the snap was correct or not.

      • drawCard

        public Card drawCard(int player)
        Draws a card, putting it in the pile, change the turn, and returning the drawn card.
        Parameters:
        player - Which player draws a card (1 or 2).
        Returns:
        the card drawn in the specified player's deck.

      • hasGameFinished

        public boolean hasGameFinished()
        Checks whether anyone has won yet, through running out of cards.
        Returns:
        true if either one has won, and false if both of the haven't won yet.

      • isWinner

        public boolean isWinner(int player)
        Checks whether a player has won or not.
        Parameters:
        player - Which player is the winner.
        Returns:
        Did someone win, draw, or lose.

      • getPlayerTurn

        public int getPlayerTurn()
        Returns the player turn when called.
        Returns:
        current player turn (1 or 2).

      • getPlayerCardsRemaining

        public int getPlayerCardsRemaining(int player)
        Returns the overall amount of cards in the specified player's deck.
        Parameters:
        player - Which player to return the deck size.
        Returns:
        Deck size of the specified player.

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
